::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

:::


The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: MFT1.2.web.orig v2.0.


> The indicative map of Intertidal forests and shrublands (MFT1.2) was developed by resampling the known global distribution of mangrove forests for the year 2000 mapped by Giri et al. (2011). We used a buffer of 1km around the distribution data and a 30 arc second grid, thus large aggregations (> 1km<sup>2</sup>) are depicted as major occurrences, and the buffer areas with small occurrences are shown as minor occurrences. The original high-resolution data is available at [UNEP-WCMC](http://data.unep-wcmc.org/datasets/4)..

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Zenodo repository (EFG map) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG files](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091027))
 - Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))
 - Mapbox tileset ([GeoTIFF version uploaded to Mapbox](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.MFT1_2_web_orig))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**MFT1.2 Intertidal forests and shrublands**](/efg-info/MFT1_2.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Indicative Map (**code: MFT1.2.WM.nwx**, version v1.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

MFT1.2.WM.nwx (v1.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/MFT1.2.WM.nwx_v1.0.tif) :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.MFT1_2_WM_nwx)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
